body_html:
I would have voted to keep the old '.cuda()' and '.cli()' API to be reflective of Torch's way of doing this, but if '.gpu()' can be called without extra arguments, then I'm okay with this, especially when multiple backends are supported.

At the same time, I'm not sure if that means '.cuda()' should be deprecated entirely, and for me it would be nice if both APIs could be supported (again, this could just be my torch bias speaking).

I would have voted to keep the old '.cuda()' and '.cli()' API to be reflective of Torch's way of doing this, but if '.gpu()' can be called without extra arguments, then I'm okay with this, especially when multiple backends are supported. 

At the same time, I'm not sure if that means '.cuda()' should be deprecated entirely, and for me it would be nice if both APIs could be supported (again, this could just be my torch bias speaking).
